Jonathan White Benefit Concert January 30, 2026
We welcome Jonathan back again!
Jonathan White will share his love for Christ with his gift of music at a fundraising event for the Avon Park Camp Special Projects Fund. Join us on Friday night, January 30, 2026, at the 7 pm service in the Avon Park Tabernacle. Jonathan has been a great friend to the camp over the past years and has now scheduled this seventh benefit concert for us.
Background Videos
Background Image
Opacity Overlay
Women's Events for 2025-2026
Ladies, Please Join in the Fun
The Avon Park Auxiliary rejoices that $6000 was donated to the camp in 2025 for projects to improve our facilities, including the Rollings Dormitory kitchen and the tabernacle bathrooms. The auxiliary invites all women to participate in this season's upcoming events to provide volunteer support to make the activities successful. Bring your smile to greet our president's wife Debbie Zile, who will speak at our retreat.
Check out upcoming events we have lined up as of now.
November 20   Fall Prayer and Praise
December 4-5   Auxiliary Garage Sale with Community-wide Sale
January 30   Retreat - morning session followed with lunch
February 1-8   Camp Meeting
February 19   Men's Appreciation Breakfast
March 5   Strawberry Shortcake Festival
March 19   Ladies' Chat
TBA   Spring Prayer and Praise

Background Image

Our Missionaires Will Speak M-F at 6 pm
Monday February 2 is Missionary Day
We welcome missionaries from One Mission Society serving in Asia,
Dr. Paul and Michelle Schuster,
and World Gospel Missions serving in Albania,
Louis Artoni and Nathan Waggoner
. In addition to the morning and evening services on Monday, the missionaries will speak Monday through Friday evenings at 6 pm.
OMS missionaries
Dr. Paul and his wife Michelle
have served in Asia for 25 years. Paul and Michelle used their professions as he a veterinarian and she a nurse, to serve the Lord in East Asia. They currently live in Korea where they serve as the Regional Directors for the Asia/Pacific Region for OMS. They have four grown children, all of whom are married.
WGM missionaries
Luis and his wife Laura
found that sports are an effective tool that can open doors and hearts to share the message of salvation. They both serve children and families in the disability community.
Nathan and his wife Cydil
felt called to missions from childhood. In September 2013, they landed in Albania.

The Dining Hall Will Be Open for Camp Meeting
Plan to dine in the morning and at at noon in the camp dining hall
7:30 to 8:15 am       Continental Breakfast
12 Noon to 12:45 pm       Dinner
An evening meal will not be served, but hot dogs, chips, drinks, ice cream and desserts are available for a fee in the dining hall after the evening service.

Welcome to Avon Park Camp
Our Beginnings
On December 30, 1937, Dr. John A. Taylor, minister of First Methodist Church in Sebring, Florida, deeded 40 acres he owned in Avon Park, to Asbury College with the stipulation that the land be used for a holiness camp ground. Dr. John Taylor, Rev. James Green and Dr. Henry Clay Morrison made the dream a reality in 1939. In respect of Dr. Taylor’s generous donation, the tabernacle was named in his honor. Since its inception, the camp's mission has been to proclaim the doctrine of entire sanctification as a definite work of grace subsequent to regeneration.
Background Videos
Background Image
Opacity Overlay
ECFA Accreditation
Avon Park Camp is ECFA accredited.
This is an achievement that should be celebrated.
It demonstrates to a watching-world that our organization is clearly dedicated and operates with financial integrity and accountability.
